analysis.reasoning: Version A surfaces highly relevant towel/bath radiators up front (recognizable towel-radiator styles, a best‑seller badge and sensible price ranges). The top results in A are focused on typical bathroom towel radiators and include items that look like popular models and deals. Version B shows more variety but includes less relevant or odd items (e.g. a small standalone heater-like unit) among the very top results which reduces perceived quality and immediate user value.
analysis.key_differences: A prioritizes classic towel-radiator models and visible deal/best‑seller signals in the top results (better immediate relevance and perceived quality). B places some design and niche models higher but also surfaces less relevant/low‑value items in the top slots, reducing overall ranking quality.
analysis.duplicate_notes: No exact identical product images were repeated within the first 8 results of either screenshot. There are visually similar models (same model in different colors or repeated later on the page), and a few items (e.g. Oppio family, Vipera) appear multiple times further down the listing, but those repeats didn’t occur within the top‑8 of either version.
analysis.duplicates_comparison: A has 0 duplicates, B has 0 duplicates
